Package com.alexandriasoftware.swing

Class VerifyingValidator

java.lang.Object
javax.swing.InputVerifier
com.alexandriasoftware.swing.JInputValidator
com.alexandriasoftware.swing.VerifyingValidator
public class VerifyingValidator extends JInputValidator
A JInputValidator that uses a standard InputVerifier to toggle a good/bad state.
Author:
Randall Wood

  • Constructor Details

    • VerifyingValidator

      public VerifyingValidator(JComponent component, InputVerifier verifier, Validation invalid)
      Create a VerifyingValidator. This is the same as calling VerifyingValidator(javax.swing.JComponent, javax.swing.InputVerifier, com.alexandriasoftware.swing.Validation, boolean, boolean) with the onInput and isVerifying parameters true.
      Parameters:
      component - the component to verify; must not be null
      verifier - the verifier to use; must not be null
      invalid - the validation to use when the InputVerifier.verify(javax.swing.JComponent) method of the verifier returns false

    • VerifyingValidator

      public VerifyingValidator(JComponent component, InputVerifier verifier, Validation invalid, boolean onInput, boolean isVerifying)
      Create a VerifyingValidator. This is the same as calling VerifyingValidator(javax.swing.JComponent, javax.swing.InputVerifier, com.alexandriasoftware.swing.Validation, com.alexandriasoftware.swing.Validation, boolean, boolean, com.alexandriasoftware.swing.JInputValidatorPreferences) with a Validation that has type Validation.Type.NONE for the valid parameter and JInputValidatorPreferences.getPreferences() for the preferences parameter.
      Parameters:
      component - the component to verify; must not be null
      verifier - the verifier to use; must not be null
      invalid - the validation to use when the InputVerifier.verify(javax.swing.JComponent) method of the verifier returns false
      onInput - true if validation should occur on every change to input; false if validation should only occur on focus changes
      isVerifying - true if validator is to return true or false per InputVerifier.verify(javax.swing.JComponent); false to always return true for that method.

    • VerifyingValidator

      public VerifyingValidator(JComponent component, InputVerifier verifier, Validation invalid, Validation valid, boolean onInput, boolean isVerifying, JInputValidatorPreferences preferences)
      Create a VerifyingValidator.
      Parameters:
      component - the component to verify; must not be null
      verifier - the verifier to use; must not be null
      invalid - the validation to use when the InputVerifier.verify(javax.swing.JComponent) method of the verifier returns false; must not be null
      valid - the validation to use when the InputVerifier.verify(javax.swing.JComponent) method of the verifier returns true; may be null
      onInput - true if validation should occur on every change to input; false if validation should only occur on focus changes
      isVerifying - true if validator is to return true or false per InputVerifier.verify(javax.swing.JComponent); false to always return true for that method.
      preferences - the preferences to use to draw the validation icons

  • Method Details

    • getValidation

      protected Validation getValidation(JComponent input, JInputValidatorPreferences preferences)
      Get the validation for the current result of calling InputVerifier.verify(javax.swing.JComponent) using the current verifier.
      Specified by:
      getValidation in class JInputValidator
      Parameters:
      input - the component to verify
      preferences - preferences to apply to Validation
      Returns:
      the Validation for the valid or invalid states as appropriate
